nodes.text: Richard Dawkins calls the process of creation by mutation and selection  the blind watchmaker  by which label he means that a purposeless materialistic designing force substitutes for the  watchmaker  deity of natural theology
a moth population in which the percentage of dark moths increased during a period when the birds were better able to see light moths against the smoke-darkened background trees
This may be taken to show that natural selection can do something but not that it can create anything that was not already in existence.
If nature could not create anything a creator is needed to explain the creation
nature had to do its own creating
There can be argument about the details but if God was not in the picture something very much like Darwinism simply has to be true regardless of the evidence.
Either the creation is admitter or the Darwinism is accepted
